member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerBinarySettings
member.summary: All the most important settings for binary serialization

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.SharpSerializerSettings`1
member.summary: Base class for the settings of the SharpSerializer. Is passed to its constructor.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.SharpSerializerSettings`1.#ctor
member.summary: IncludeAssemblyVersionInTypeName, IncludeCultureInTypeName and IncludePublicKeyTokenInTypeName are true

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.SharpSerializerSettings`1.AdvancedSettings
member.summary: Contains mostly classes from the namespace Polenter.Serialization.Advanced

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.SharpSerializerSettings`1.IncludeAssemblyVersionInTypeName
member.summary: Version=x.x.x.x will be inserted to the type name

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.SharpSerializerSettings`1.IncludeCultureInTypeName
member.summary: Culture=.... will be inserted to the type name

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.SharpSerializerSettings`1.IncludePublicKeyTokenInTypeName
member.summary: PublicKeyToken=.... will be inserted to the type name

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerBinarySettings.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Serialization in SizeOptimized mode. For other modes choose an overloaded constructor

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerBinarySettings.#ctor(Polenter.Serialization.BinarySerializationMode)
member.summary: Overloaded constructor. Chooses mode in which the data is serialized.
member.param: SizeOptimized - all types are stored in a header, objects only reference these types (better for collections). Burst - all types are serialized with their objects (better for serializing of single objects).

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerBinarySettings.Encoding
member.summary: How are strings serialized. Default is UTF-8.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerBinarySettings.Mode
member.summary: Default is SizeOptimized - Types and property names are stored in a header. The opposite is Burst mode when all types are serialized with their objects.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.XmlPropertySerializer
member.summary: Serializes properties to xml or any other target which supports node/attribute notation
member.remarks: Use an instance of your own IXmlWriter in the constructor to target other storage standards

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.PropertySerializer
member.summary: Base class for all Serializers (Xml, Binary, ...). XmlPropertySerializer inherits from this class

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.IPropertySerializer
member.summary: Serializes property to a stream

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.IPropertySerializer.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Open the stream for writing

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.IPropertySerializer.Serialize(Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property)
member.summary: Serializes property

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.IPropertySerializer.Close
member.summary: Cleaning, but the stream can be used further

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.PropertySerializer.Serialize(Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property)
member.summary: Serializes property

member.summary: Open the stream for writing

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.PropertySerializer.Close
member.summary: Cleaning, but the stream can be used further

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.XmlPropertySerializer.writeProperties(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property},System.Type)
member.summary: Properties are only saved if at least one property exists
member.param: to which type belong the properties

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.XmlPropertySerializer.SerializeReference(Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceTargetProperty)
member.summary: Stores only reference to an object, not the object itself

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.XmlPropertySerializer.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Open the writer

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.XmlPropertySerializer.Close
member.summary: Close the Write, but do not close the stream

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertyProvider
member.summary:
Provides properties to serialize from source object. Implements the strategy which subproperties to use and wich to ignore and how to travese the source object to get subproperties
Its methods GetAllProperties and IgnoreProperty can be overwritten in an inherited class to customize its functionality. Its property PropertiesToIgnore contains properties, which are ignored during the serialization.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertyProvider.GetProperties(Polenter.Serialization.Serializing.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Gives all properties back which: - are public - are not static - does not contain ExcludeFromSerializationAttribute - have their set and get accessors - are not indexers

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertyProvider.IgnoreProperty(Polenter.Serialization.Serializing.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Should the property be removed from serialization?
member.returns: true if the property: - is in the PropertiesToIgnore, - contains ExcludeFromSerializationAttribute, - does not have it's set or get accessor - is indexer

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertyProvider.ContainsExcludeFromSerializationAttribute(System.Reflection.ICustomAttributeProvider)
member.summary: Determines whether is excluded from serialization or not.
member.returns: true if no serialization

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertyProvider.GetAllProperties(System.Type)
member.summary: Gives all properties back which: - are public - are not static (instance properties)

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertyProvider.PropertiesToIgnore
member.summary: Which properties should be ignored
member.remarks: Sometimes you want to ignore some properties during the serialization. If they are parts of your own business objects, you can mark these properties with ExcludeFromSerializationAttribute. However it is not possible to mark them in the built in .NET classes In such a case you add these properties to the list PropertiesToIgnore. I.e. System.Collections.Generic.List"string" has the "Capacity" property which is irrelevant for the whole Serialization and should be ignored PropertyProvider.PropertiesToIgnore.Add(typeof(List"string"), "Capacity")

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertyProvider.AttributesToIgnore
member.summary: All Properties markt with one of the contained attribute-types will be ignored on save.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.PropertiesToIgnore
member.summary: Cache which contains type as a key, and all associated property names

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Serializing.PropertyTypeInfo`1
member.summary: Contains info about property and its type. It is of use to avoid double type definitions.
member.remarks: During serialization is each property wrapped in this class. there is no need to define type of every array element if there is a global ElementType type defined and each array element type is equal to that global ElementType In such a case ElementType is stored in ExpectedPropertyType, ValueType contains null.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Serializing.PropertyTypeInfo`1.ExpectedPropertyType
member.summary: Of what type should be this property

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Serializing.PropertyTypeInfo`1.ValueType
member.summary: Of what type is the property value. If it is null - then the value type is equal to expectedPropertyType and does not need to be additionally serialized

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Serializing.PropertyTypeInfo`1.Name
member.summary: Property name

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Serializing.PropertyTypeInfo`1.Property
member.summary: Property itself

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.Elements
member.summary: These elements are used during the binary serialization. They should be unique from SubElements and Attributes.

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.Elements.ComplexObjectWithId
member.summary: For binary compatibility reason extra type-id: same as ComplexObjectWith, but contains

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.Elements.Reference
member.summary: reference to previosly serialized ComplexObjectWithId

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.SubElements
member.summary: These elements are used during the binary serialization. They should be unique from Elements and Attributes.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.Attributes
member.summary: These attributes are used during the binary serialization. They should be unique from Elements and SubElements.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.NumberSize
member.summary: How many bytes occupies a number value

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.NumberSize.Zero
member.summary: is zero

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.NumberSize.B1
member.summary: serializes as 1 byte

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.NumberSize.B2
member.summary: serializes as 2 bytes

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.NumberSize.B4
member.summary: serializes as 4 bytes

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.NumberSize.GetNumberSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gives the least required byte amount to store the number

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.BinarySerializationMode
member.summary: What format has the serialized binary file. It could be SizeOptimized or Burst.

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.BinarySerializationMode.SizeOptimized
member.summary: All types are serialized to string lists, which are stored in the file header. Duplicates are removed. Serialized objects only reference these types. It reduces size especially if serializing collections. Refer to SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter for more details.

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.BinarySerializationMode.Burst
member.summary: There are as many type definitions as many objects stored, not regarding if there are duplicate types defined. It reduces the overhead if storing single items, but increases the file size if storing collections. See BurstBinaryWriter for details.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.BurstBinaryWriter
member.summary: Stores data in a binary format. All types and property names which describe an object are stored together with the object. If there are more objects to store, their types are multiple stored, what increases the file size. This format is simple and has small overhead.

member.summary: Writes Element Id

member.summary: Writes an integer. It saves the number with the least required bytes

member.summary: Writes an array of numbers. It saves numbers with the least required bytes

member.summary: Writes property name

member.summary: Writes a simple value (value of a simple property)

member.summary: Opens the stream for writing

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.BurstBinaryWriter.Close
member.summary: Saves the data to the stream, the stream is not closed and can be further used

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer
member.summary: This is the main class of SharpSerializer. It serializes and deserializes objects.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.#ctor
member.summary: Standard Constructor. Default is Xml serializing

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overloaded constructor
member.param: true - binary serialization with SizeOptimized mode, false - xml. For more options use other overloaded constructors.

member.summary: Xml serialization with custom settings

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.#ctor(Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerBinarySettings)
member.summary: Binary serialization with custom settings

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.#ctor(Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Serializing.IPropertySerializer,Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Deserializing.IPropertyDeserializer)
member.summary: Custom serializer and deserializer

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.Serialize(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Serializing to a file. File will be always new created and closed after the serialization.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.Serialize(System.Object,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Serializing to the stream. After serialization the stream will NOT be closed.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Deserializing from the file. After deserialization the file will be closed.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.Deserialize(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Deserialization from the stream. After deserialization the stream will NOT be closed.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializer.PropertyProvider
member.summary: Default it is an instance of PropertyProvider. It provides all properties to serialize. You can use an Ihneritor and overwrite its GetAllProperties and IgnoreProperty methods to implement your custom rules.

member.summary: What name should have the root property. Default is "Root".

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.DefaultXmlWriter.getArrayOfIntAsText(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Converts int[] {1,2,3,4,5} to text "1,2,3,4,5"

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter
member.summary: Stores data in a binary format. Data is stored in two steps. At first are all objects stored in a cache and all types are analysed. Then all types and property names are sorted and placed in a list. Duplicates are removed. Serialized objects contain references to these types and property names. It decreases file size, especially for serialization of collection (many items of the same type) SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter has bigger overhead than BurstBinaryWriter

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.WriteElementId(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes Property Id

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.WriteType(System.Type)
member.summary: Writes type

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.WriteName(System.String)
member.summary: Writes property name

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.WriteValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Writes a simple value (value of a simple property)

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.WriteNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes an integer. It saves the number with the least required bytes

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.WriteNumbers(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Writes an array of numbers. It saves numbers with the least required bytes

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens the stream for writing

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter.Close
member.summary: Saves the data to the stream, the stream is not closed and can be further used

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SimpleValueConverter
member.summary: Converts simple types to/from their text representation
member.remarks: It is important to use the same ISimpleValueConverter during serialization and deserialization Especially Format of the DateTime and float types can be differently converted in different cultures. To customize it, please use the Constructor with the specified CultureInfo, or inherit your own converter from ISimpleValueConverter

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.Xml.ISimpleValueConverter
member.summary: Converts values of SimpleProperty to/from string

member.returns: string.Empty if the value is null

member.param: expected type. Result should be of this type.
member.returns: null if the text is null

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.SimpleValueConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Default is CultureInfo.InvariantCulture used

member.summary: Here you can customize the culture. I.e. System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture

member.returns: string.Empty if the value is null

member.param: expected type. Result should be of this type.
member.returns: null if the text is null

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.BinaryPropertyDeserializer
member.summary: Contains logic to deserialize data from a binary format. Format can vary according to the used IBinaryWriter. For data serialized with BurstBinaryWriter you use BurstBinaryReader and for SizeOptimizedBinaryWriter you use SizeOptimizedBinaryReader

member.name: F:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.BinaryPropertyDeserializer._propertyCache
member.summary: Properties already processed. Used for reference resolution.

member.summary: Reading the property

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.BinaryPropertyDeserializer.Close
member.summary: Cleans all

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property
member.summary: Base class for all properties. Every object can be defined with inheritors of the Property class.

member.summary: Gets the property art.

member.summary: Creates property from PropertyArt
member.returns: null if PropertyArt.Reference is requested

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property.Name
member.summary: Not all properties have name (i.e. items of a collection)

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property.Type
member.summary: Of what type is the property or its value

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property.Parent
member.summary: If the properties are nested, i.e. collection items are nested in the collection

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Property.Art
member.summary: Of what art is the property.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceTargetProperty
member.summary: All properties derived from this property can be a target of a reference

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceTargetProperty.MakeFlatCopyFrom(Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceTargetProperty)
member.summary: Makes flat copy (only references) of vital properties

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceTargetProperty.Reference
member.summary: Information about the References for this property

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceInfo
member.summary: Provides information about property references

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceInfo.Count
member.summary: How many references to the same object

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceInfo.Id
member.summary: Every Object must have a unique Id

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.ReferenceInfo.IsProcessed
member.summary: During serialization is true if the target object was already serialized. Then the target must not be serialized again. Only its reference must be created. During deserialization it means, the target object was parsed and read from the stream. It can be further used to resolve its references.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.NullProperty
member.summary: Represents the null value. Null values are serialized too.

member.summary: Gets the property art.

member.summary: It represents some properties of an object, or some items of a collection/dictionary/array

member.summary: Parent property

member.summary: It could only one of the simple types, see Tools.IsSimple(...)

member.summary: Information about one item in a multidimensional array

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.MultiDimensionalArrayItem.Indexes
member.summary: Represents item coordinates in the array (i.e. [1,5,3] - item has index 1 in the dimension 0, index 5 in the dimension 1 and index 3 in the dimension 2).

member.summary: Item value. It can contain any type.

member.summary: Start index for the array

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.DimensionInfo.Length
member.summary: How many items are in this dimension

member.summary: Represents key. There can be everything

member.summary: used as an id for referencing already serialized items

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerXmlSettings
member.summary: All the most important settings for xml serialization

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerXmlSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Standard constructor with Culture=InvariantCulture and Encoding=UTF8

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerXmlSettings.Culture
member.summary: All float numbers and date/time values are stored as text according to the Culture. Default is CultureInfo.InvariantCulture. This setting is overridden if you set AdvancedSettings.SimpleValueConverter

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.SharpSerializerXmlSettings.Encoding
member.summary: Describes format in which the xml file is stored. Default is UTF-8. This setting is overridden if you set AdvancedSettings.XmlWriterSettings

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.IndexGenerator`1
member.summary: Is used to store types and property names in lists. Contains only unique elements and gives index of the item back. During deserialization this index is read from stream and then replaced with an appropriate value from the list.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.IndexGenerator`1.GetIndexOfItem(`0)
member.summary: if the item exist, it gives its index back, otherweise the item is added and its new index is given back

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter
member.summary: Converts Type to its text representation and vice versa. Since v.2.12 all types serialize to the AssemblyQualifiedName. Use overloaded constructor to shorten type names.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Since v.2.12 as default the type name is equal to Type.AssemblyQualifiedName

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Some values from the Type.AssemblyQualifiedName can be removed

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter.ConvertToTypeName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gives type as text
member.returns: string.Empty if the type is null

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter.ConvertToType(System.String)
member.summary: Gives back Type from the text.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter.IncludeAssemblyVersion
member.summary: Version=x.x.x.x will be inserted to the type name

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter.IncludeCulture
member.summary: Culture=.... will be inserted to the type name

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.TypeNameConverter.IncludePublicKeyToken
member.summary: PublicKeyToken=.... will be inserted to the type name

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.ExcludeFromSerializationAttribute
member.summary: All labeled with that Attribute object properties are ignored during the serialization. See PropertyProvider

member.summary: Open the stream for writing

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Advanced.BinaryPropertySerializer.Close
member.summary: Closes the stream

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Tools
member.summary: Some help functions for the serializing framework. As these functions are complexer they can be converted to single classes.

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Tools.IsSimple(System.Type)
member.summary: Is the simple type (string, DateTime, TimeSpan, Decimal, Enumeration or other primitive type)

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Tools.IsEnumerable(System.Type)
member.summary: Is type an IEnumerable

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Tools.IsCollection(System.Type)
member.summary: Is type ICollection

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Tools.IsDictionary(System.Type)
member.summary: Is type IDictionary

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Tools.IsArray(System.Type)
member.summary: Is it array? It does not matter if singledimensional or multidimensional

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Tools.CreateInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates instance from type. There must be a standard constructor (without parameters) in the type.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.BinaryWriterTools
member.summary: Some methods which are used by IBinaryWriter

member.name: M:Polenter.Serialization.Core.Binary.BinaryWriterTools.WriteString(System.String,System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: BinaryWriter.Write(string...) can not be used as it produces exception if the text is null.

member.name: T:Polenter.Serialization.Core.AdvancedSharpSerializerXmlSettings
member.summary: Base class for the advanced settings. Is common for the binary and xml serialization.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.AdvancedSharpSerializerSettings.PropertiesToIgnore
member.summary: Which properties should be ignored during the serialization.
member.remarks: In your business objects you can mark these properties with ExcludeFromSerializationAttribute In built in .NET Framework classes you can not do this. Therefore you define these properties here. I.e. System.Collections.Generic.List has property Capacity which is irrelevant for the whole Serialization and should be ignored.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.AdvancedSharpSerializerSettings.AttributesToIgnore
member.summary: All Properties marked with one of the contained attribute-types will be ignored on save. As default, this list contains only ExcludeFromSerializationAttribute. For performance reasons it would be better to clear this list if this attribute is not used in serialized classes.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.AdvancedSharpSerializerSettings.RootName
member.summary: What name has the root item of your serialization. Default is "Root".

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.AdvancedSharpSerializerSettings.TypeNameConverter
member.summary: Converts Type to string and vice versa. Default is an instance of TypeNameConverter which serializes Types as "type name, assembly name" If you want to serialize your objects as fully qualified assembly name, you should set this setting with an instance of TypeNameConverter with overloaded constructor.

member.name: P:Polenter.Serialization.Core.AdvancedSharpSerializerXmlSettings.SimpleValueConverter
member.summary: Converts simple values to string and vice versa. Default it is an instance of SimpleValueConverter with CultureInfo.InvariantCulture. You can override the default converter to implement your own converting to/from string.
